did.head: Collection Overview

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution

did.abstract: This one-volume scrapbook contains clippings dating from 1937 to 1975, that document the career of Cuban American painter, Cundo Bermúdez.
did.langmaterial: The records are in English and Spanish.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in Havana in 1914, Cuban modernist painter Cundo Bermúdez exhibited his work extensively in Latin America and had his first one-man show in the United States at the Pan American Union in 1948.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a one-volume scrapbook of clippings from Cuban, American, and Puerto Rican newspapers that date from 1937 to 1975. The scrapbook provides scattered documentation of the career of Cuban American painter, Cundo Bermúdez, and primarily contains exhibition reviews.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed in the online catalog of the Archives of American Art under the following index terms. People, families and organizations are listed under "Names" when they are creators or contributors and under "Subjects" when they are the topic of collection contents.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The scrapbook was loaned to the Archives of American Art for microfilming in 1996 by Teresa Callava, great-niece of Cundo Bermúdez, and was returned to Callava in 1997.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Patrons must use microfilm copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership and Literary Rights
userestrict.p: The Cundo Bermúdez scrapbook was loaned to the Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution, for microfilming. The collection is subject to all copyright laws.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms Available
altformavail.p: The scrapbook is available on microfilm reel 5138 only.
